name: deniability
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the ability to deny something (= say that something is not true): He is expert at making you believe something without actually saying it, thereby always giving him deniability.plausible deniability Those legitimate prescriptions gave the athlete plausible deniability for his positive drug tests.
More examplesFewer examplesThey tried to avoid direct involvement in the war, and to maintain plausible deniability. Many hackers are able to exist in a zone of deniability. Through carefully preserved deniability, they escape responsibility for events they have encouraged, but not directly ordered.
